a.n: Beethoven - Piano Concerto No. 2 - III. Rondo

p.k: The European Concert has been a tradition of the Berliner Philharmoniker since 1991. In 2000, the orchestra played at home in the Berlin Philharmonic Hall under the baton of Claudio Abbado with the Swedish Radio Choir and other soloists.
p.d: Mikhail Pletnev (piano), Karita Mattila (soprano), Violeta Urmana (alto), Thomas Moser (tenor), Eike Wilm Schulte (bass), Swedish Radio Choir, Eric Ericson Chamber Choir, Berlin Philharmonic Orchestra, conductor: Claudio Abbado. Ludwig van Beethoven (1770-1827): Piano Concerto No. 2 in B flat major, Op. 19 - Symphony No. 9 in D minor, Op. 125. The European Concert has been a tradition of the Berliner Philharmoniker since 1991. The musicians commemorate the anniversary of the orchestra's founding on May 1st, 1882, playing in different European cities. In 2000, the orchestra played at home in the Berlin Philharmonic Hall.
